title: Turk Cryptourrency Exchange Front-end
text:
## Overview

I Worked as a member of the front-end team for Turk Cryptocurrency website. Designed and developed UIs and some logic and API calls to backend. We used Vue.js framework and Typescript in this project. Although this was my first experience in team development, but I learnd different things about frontend and technologies.

## API calls

We used repository pattern, which makes API calls easier. Also this is a big challenge that we need to develop the frontend without interfering much with backend. This pattern made this easier to create fake client and mock data to do our job without stopping for backend team.

## TypeScript

Coding in TypeScript language is very important. TypeScript gave us a big advantage for setting the types of variables, parameters and interfaces to develop faster and make sure our code runs correctly. I learned the basics of TypeScript in this project.


### Links
[Live](https://trk.alimahdiyar.ir/)

title: Hour of Code Website
text:
## Overview

HOC is an all-day event held by computer engineering students at Shiraz University to familiarize high school students with coding. However, the event was held online due to COVID-19.

I designed the UI/UX of the website with Adobe XD software. That was my first experience in designing UI/UX. Special thanks to Mr. Cena Saeedi for teaching and helping me in this project.

title: Sess semester web application
text:
## Overview

A front-end website that manages crawled data from Shiraz University term semester website. This project started because the Computer Science Association of Shiraz University held a contest to visualize data. I started learning Vue.js framework then. The result was I won the contest but continued working more on improving this web application.

title: Hour of Code Game
text:
# Overview

This is a 2-Player game which has 3 modes:

* Human vs Human
* Human vs Agent
* Agent vs Agent
  
A player has to draw or exchange cards from the board cards so that the sum of his/her 3 cards would be 15.

No one can have more than 3 cards in his/her hand, and a player must draw or exchange a card.

The main purpose of this game is that students have to write an agent with Python language, and compete with each other and brawl !

This game is developed by [Amirreza Ektesabi](https://github.com/ar-ekt/) (Game Design) and [Amirhosein Gharaati](https://github.com/AmirHosein-Gharaati/) (UI/UX design)

Special thanks to [ACM-ICPC association of Shiraz University](http://acm.shirazu.ac.ir/) for holding this ceremony
